name: Police Bay Warding
description: The noon sun blazes overhead as strong trade winds whip Police Bay into a frenzy of white-capped rollers. Two weathered pirates brace against a mast-spar driven deep into the sand, while a witch traces protective veve symbols with driftwood in the churning surf. Crossed cutlasses lie embedded in the sand, their shadows forming the numbers 2 and 6—a cipher written in steel and light that counts truer than any sundial. Bearing 226°. Cipher output: PI. "Shadowed steel counts truer than the sun."
riddle: Shadowed steel counts truer than the sun.
